title: Porter Airlines is increasing service between Boston and Canada
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Porter Airlines will add two direct routes from Boston to Montréal and Toronto starting May 14, 2026.
The expanded service includes seven weekly flights to Montréal and 14 weekly flights to Toronto Pearson from Logan Airport.
Porter Airlines' network is growing by 20%, with free WiFi, snacks, and drinks on Embraer E195-E2 planes.

title: Healey signs collaboration agreement with Denmark amid Greenland tensions
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: Governor Maura Healey signed a collaboration agreement with Denmark to enhance Massachusetts' ties in research, innovation, and trade.
The agreement was signed amid U.S.-Denmark tensions over President Trump's renewed interest in purchasing Greenland.
Denmark is a major partner, accounting for $250 million in annual trade with Massachusetts and significant U.S. investment.

title: Traveling to Super Bowl LX? Here’s what to see and do in Santa Clara.
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Santa Clara offers free activities including Central Park, the San Tomas Aquino Creek Trail, and several museums like the Intel Museum.
Visitors can explore Santa Clara's diverse dining scene through the Global Games Food Trail featuring 24 international cuisine options.
California's Great America amusement park in Santa Clara features the Gold Striker, a prominent wooden rollercoaster known for its speed and height.

title: What Boston looked like in 2019 when the Patriots last won the Super Bowl
author: Kelly Chan
bullets: The Patriots won Super Bowl LIII against the LA Rams on February 3, 2019, marking their sixth championship.
In early 2019, Boston celebrated sports victories with Celtics, Bruins, and Red Sox adding to the city's championship history.
By February 2019, Encore Boston Harbor was still under construction and opened later that year in June.

title: Officer and civilian shot, suspect killed in Spencer
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Suspect Patrick Madison was killed in a gunfire exchange with police after barricading himself inside a Family Dollar bathroom.
A Millbury police officer was injured and hospitalized in stable condition following the standoff with Patrick Madison.
An unidentified civilian was shot by Madison on Main Street and transported to UMass Medical Center for treatment.

title: Cape Cod house with Watergate ties falls victim to eroding bluff
author: Regina Cole
bullets: Demolition started on the Bartlett House in Eastham on February 3, 2026, due to coastal erosion risks.
The house, used by Nixon's officials, was linked to Watergate as the site where the Ellsberg burglary was authorized.
The Cape Cod National Seashore deemed the house unsafe in 2024, leading to its demolition for safety and ecological reasons.

title: UMass Lowell wants to make the city a destination with a new rink and hotel
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: UMass Lowell proposes an ice rink and hotel to boost tourism and local economy in Lowell.
The projects are part of the Lowell Innovation Network Corridor to integrate education, business, and entertainment.
The plans aim to increase events at Tsongas Center and address the shortage of downtown hotels in Lowell.

title: Judge drops assault charge against former City Hall staffer
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: A judge dropped a domestic violence charge against Chulan Huang, a former Boston City Hall staffer, after the victim did not testify.
The incident involved Marwa Khudaynazar, also a city employee, who is suing the city alleging wrongful termination connected to Segun Idowu.
Federal judge dismissed most claims by Khudaynazar against Boston city officials but allowed a First Amendment retaliation claim to proceed.

title: This Rowley inn is the perfect place for romance
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Briar Barn Inn in Rowley named a top Valentine’s Day retreat by The Hotel Guru.
JetBlue and Delta ranked among safest airlines of 2026 by AirlineRatings.com.
Great Wolf Lodge offering $26 per person flash sale on Feb. 6 valid for stays until June 18.

title: A dispute over a shoveled-out parking space led to a stabbing in Dorchester, police say
author: John Waller
bullets: A Dorchester parking space dispute led to a stabbing on Evans St. early Wednesday morning.
A 41-year-old man and 47-year-old woman suffered hand injuries and were hospitalized after the incident.
Enel Javier, 47, was arrested and charged with assault using a dangerous weapon after allegedly stabbing the man.
